classificationProperties.name: ACResistance
classificationProperties.description: The resistance under AC.

classificationProperties.name: CurrentCarryingCapacity
classificationProperties.description: Maximum value of electric current which can be carried continuously by a conductor, a device or an apparatus, under specified conditions without its steady-state temperature exceeding a  specified value. Based on IEC60826-11-13. NOTE: The temperature specified value is maximum Design Ambient Temperature.

classificationProperties.name: DCResistance
classificationProperties.description: The resistance under direct current and 20 degrees centigrade.

classificationProperties.name: FunctionReliable
classificationProperties.description: Element (such as cable, bus, core) maintain given properties/functions over a given (tested) time and conditions. According to IEC standard.

classificationProperties.name: HalogenProof
classificationProperties.description: Produces small amount of smoke and irritating Deaerator/Gas.

classificationProperties.name: HasProtectiveEarth
classificationProperties.description: Indicates whether the object has a protective earth connection (=TRUE) or not (= FALSE).

classificationProperties.name: InsulationVoltage
classificationProperties.description: The insulation voltage.

classificationProperties.name: MassPerLength
classificationProperties.description: Mass per length, i.e. mass of a beam with a unit length of extrusion. For example measured in kg/m.

classificationProperties.name: MaximumBendingRadius
classificationProperties.description: The maximum bending radius that the cable could withstand.

classificationProperties.name: MaximumCurrent
classificationProperties.description: The maximum allowed current that a device is certified to handle.

classificationProperties.name: MaximumOperatingTemperature
classificationProperties.description: The maximum temperature at which a cable or bus is certified to operate.

classificationProperties.name: MaximumShortCircuitTemperature
classificationProperties.description: The maximum short circuit temperature at which a cable or bus is certified to operate.

classificationProperties.name: NumberOfCores
classificationProperties.description: The number of cores.

classificationProperties.name: NumberOfWires
classificationProperties.description: The number of wires used in the element.

classificationProperties.name: OverallDiameter
classificationProperties.description: The overall diameter of a object.

classificationProperties.name: ScreenDiameter
classificationProperties.description: The diameter of the screen around an object (if present).

classificationProperties.name: SelfExtinguishing60332_1
classificationProperties.description: Self Extinguishing cable/core according to IEC 60332.1.

classificationProperties.name: SelfExtinguishing60332_3
classificationProperties.description: Self Extinguishing cable/core according to IEC 60332.3.

classificationProperties.name: SpecialConstruction
classificationProperties.description: Special construction capabilities like self-supporting, flat devidable cable or bus flat non devidable cable or bus supporting elements inside (steal, textile, concentric conductor). Note that materials used should be agreed between exchange participants before use.

classificationProperties.name: Standard
classificationProperties.description: The designation of the standard applicable for the definition of the object used.

classificationProperties.name: Weight
classificationProperties.description: Total weight of object

classificationProperties.name: CharacteristicImpedance
classificationProperties.description:
A quantity defined for a mode of propagation at a given frequency in a specific uniform transmission line or uniform waveguide by one of the three following relations:
Z1 = S/ |I|2
Z2 = |U|2 / S
Z3 = U / I
where Z is the complex characteristic impedance, S the complex power and U and I are the values, usually complex, respectively of a voltage and a current conventionally defined for each type of mode by analogy with transmission line equations.

classificationProperties.name: CouplingLoss
classificationProperties.description: Indicates the coupling loss of a leaky coaxial cable (radiating cable).

classificationProperties.name: MaximumTransmissionAttenuation
classificationProperties.description: Indicates the Maximum transmission attenuation of feeder.

classificationProperties.name: NumberOfCoaxialPairs
classificationProperties.description: Indicates the total number of coaxial pairs in the coaxial cable.

classificationProperties.name: PropagationSpeedCoefficient
classificationProperties.description: Indicates the propagation speed coefficient.

classificationProperties.name: RadiantFrequency
classificationProperties.description: Indicates the radiant frequency of the leaky coaxial cable (radiating cable).

classificationProperties.name: TransmissionLoss
classificationProperties.description: Indicates the transmission loss of the leaky coaxial cable (radiating cable).

classificationProperties.name: JacketColour
classificationProperties.description: Indicates the colour of the cable or fitting jacket.

classificationProperties.name: NumberOfTwistedPairs
classificationProperties.description: Total number of twisted wire pairs in copper pair cables.

classificationProperties.name: NumberOfUntwistedPairs
classificationProperties.description: Total number of untwisted wire pairs in the copper pair cable.

definition: Cable with a specific purpose to lead electric current within a circuit or any other electric construction. Includes all types of electric cables, mainly several core segments or conductor segments wrapped together.
name: IfcCableSegment.CABLESEGMENT
